result.execSummary:
The defendant Carly R. Belding was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carly R. Belding is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carly R. Belding was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Comply with rules in 15-CF-251.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carly R. Belding

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty Cassi Baumgardner.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  928 - Parties have rec'd and reviewed revocation packet, and are prepared to proceed. Sentence recommendations.  Defendant is sentenced to 1 year in the Kenosha County Jail w/huber.  Credit for 260 days. No new costs ordered - any outstanding costs may be converted to civil judgment. Firearms warning, Voters rights, Appeal rights given.
Sentencing on 2/4/16 by Tracy Czarnecki-Kozmer
Atty C Baumgardner.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 21, 2017 at 09:30 am.
For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
AMENDED - Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Firearms warning.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Carl Johnson.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1140 - Parties appear for a bond motion, but are prepared to go to sentencing without PSI. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 24months w/conditions concurrent to 15CF251 - ** To serve 10 days KCJ as a condition of probation. ** 97 days sentence credit if probation revoked.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.C ourt costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Voter rights, Firearm warning, and Appeal rights given.
for Review of Bail filed by Atty Carl Johnson
Per Atty Johnson, SEH changed to a bond hearing. PSI writer has been out on unexpected medical leave and has been unable to complete PSI for sentencing. SEH to be rescheduled following bond motion.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Rocco DeFilippis.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1042 -   Victim rights compliance. Matter has been resolved.  DE enters plea of guilty as to CT1; found guilty by the court. Ct2 dismissed outright. PSI ordered. DNA collection notice given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
